snippet: Excessive servings of tuna casserole is just one example of marital distress from the divorce dockets of England, which does not have no-fault divorce.
abstract: Many English matrimonial lawyers and judges are campaigning to change laws to allow for no-fault divorce; absence of such a provision keeps courts flooded with spurious debates over superficial, and sometimes humorous, domestic disputes as spouses accuse each other of 'unreasonable behavior,' one of five categories under which divorce can currently be granted.
lead_paragraph: Excessive servings of tuna casserole is just one example of marital distress from the divorce dockets of England, which does not have no-fault divorce.

headline.seo: Divorce, English Style: Fault-Finding as Fine Art
headline.main: Tuna Again? In Fault-Finding England, It’s a Cause for Divorce
headline.print_headline: Tuna Again? In Fault-Finding Britain, It’s a Cause for Divorce
